revised_title: Experiments and Observations on the Attractive Powers of Mineral Acids and Their Solutions with Metals
tldr: The author investigates the attractive powers of mineral acids, specifically vitriolic, nitrous, and marine acids, and their solutions with metals such as iron, copper, and tin. The experiments reveal the solubility and properties of metal salts in different acids, as well as the production of various types of air, including inflammable and vitriolic air.
